summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a BOP correctional lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York City on September 23, 2021. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, including the prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, the failure to assign a cellmate, non-functioning cameras, and potential procedural failures in counts, rounds, and supervision.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose/rope in his SHU cell. The SIS lieutenant investigated, interviewing Epstein and cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Epstein stated he did not try to harm himself and that Tartaglione did not try to harm him. The investigation was deemed inconclusive.

events.title: Cameras Found Not Recording
events.description: The SIS lieutenant discovered the MCC's camera system was not recording while trying to review footage with an associate warden. She notified the captain and wrote a memo. The cameras had reportedly stopped recording since July 29, 2019.

events.title: Reyes Transferred, Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (not taken to court as initially believed). Epstein was left without a cellmate, contrary to psychological requirements. Multiple staff failures occurred in notifying supervisors and assigning a new cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein's unit manager allegedly allowed him to make a phone call on an unsecured line in the SHU shower area. Epstein said he was calling his mother (who was deceased). The call was not properly monitored or logged, a security violation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his SHU cell at MCC New York. He was found with a noose. The lieutenant was called in around 6:00 AM and began gathering evidence.

keyFacts: The lieutenant's investigation into the July 23, 2019 incident was inconclusive; Epstein denied trying to harm himself and said his cellmate did not harm him.

Epstein was supposed to have a cellmate per psychological directive, but was left alone after Efrain Reyes was transferred on August 9, 2019, due to a systemic notification failure among multiple officers and lieutenants.
The MCC camera system stopped recording on July 29, 2019, and was not fixed prior to Epstein's death, despite the lieutenant notifying the captain and associate warden on August 8.
The lieutenant believes Epstein's death was a suicide resulting from systemic failures, including lack of a cellmate and potential failures in conducting counts and rounds.
Epstein was allowed an unmonitored, unlogged phone call on an unsecured line the night before his death, a significant security violation.
